title: Geth not finding peers. Time is NTP synchronized.
body:
#### System information

```
$ ./geth version
Geth
Version: 1.4.7-stable-667a386d
Protocol Versions: [63 62 61]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.6.2
OS: linux
GOPATH=/home/pewpew/go
GOROOT=/opt/google/go

$ timedatectl
      Local time: Thu 2016-06-23 02:42:49 SGT
  Universal time: Wed 2016-06-22 18:42:49 UTC
        Timezone: Asia/Singapore (SGT, +0800)
     NTP enabled: yes
NTP synchronized: yes
 RTC in local TZ: no
      DST active: n/a
```

Also tested on `1.5.0-unstable`, which was what I was using before it suddenly stopped syncing.
#### Expected behaviour

`geth` should find peers and sync
#### Actual behaviour

It was actually working a while ago, before I stopped running it for a week. Now it is unable to find peers to sync. I have tried removing the `.ethereum` to resync with `geth --fast` but to no avail. `geth` is stuck trying to find peers
#### Backtrace (with `--verbosity 6`)

```
I0623 02:38:13.358344 p2p/discover/table.go:389] no seed nodes found
I0623 02:38:13.358401 p2p/server.go:469] <-taskdone: discovery lookup

I0623 02:38:16.858049 p2p/discover/database.go:183] failed to retrieve node 979b7fa28feeb35a4741660a16076f1943202cb72b6af70d327f053e248bab9ba81760f39d0701ef1d8f89cc1fbd2cacba0710a12cd5314d5e0c9021aa3637f9: leveldb: not found
```

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
